title: How losing just one share certificate can cost you 75pc of your investment
text:
Savers are losing almost three quarters of their investment to fees because of steep charged levied for replacing lost paper certificates.

Share registrars can charge as much as £73 to reissue lost share certificates, valued at as little as £101.

Around one in ten shares are still held outside of Isa accounts in certificate form – worth roughly £224bn, according to data from the Office for National Statistics.

More than half of British investors hold old-fashioned certificates for at least some of their share holdings, according to separate statistics from the Department for Innovation, Business and Skills. Many became shareholders for the first time during the privatisation of national industries...
